{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3567951,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T13:47:35.960Z","cooked":"

Hey, I am a senior at FRC6548 Perry Rambots, and we are looking for help with our limelight.

We are using the CTRE generated swerve with a pigeon, cancoders krakens, and mk4is. For vision we are using a single ll3 that is position to see up close at the middle of the reef apriltags and very far away it can see the reef tags.

At our first competition we ran our 3 L4 coral auto without vision and noticed that it wasn’t as consistent as we would have liked. (Often never scoring any coral)

At our second competition we quickly coded some megatag2 code, however it was quite shifty. We reset our yaw for megatag2 with megatag1 when robotcontainer was initialized. It worked pretty well, however one MASSIVE issue was that when people stood in front of the apriltags when robotcontainer was initialized our pose was completely messed up. In the 1 or 2 matches our robot didn’t go haywire it scored 3 coral…

We would love to get in contact with a team that has the time to setup a zoom or something of the sort to help us with our limelight code.

I think most teams just set up their robot at a precise known angle, and then initialize their gyro to start at that angle - no MT1 needed. CTRE generated swerve has a resetPose method you can call at the start of auto. Just remember it’s always from the blue alliance perspective.

microbuns:

I think most teams just set up their robot at a precise known angle

That’s what we were doing with straight MT2 the whole time. Our auto only scored 1 coral, but our teleop auto align behaved the same way and was pretty dead on. Just had to make sure we carefully aligned the robot at match start.

What we do is run a task in DisabledPeriodic that continually gets the Limelight MegaTag2 pose. So, on the field, eventually the people that might be blocking the AprilTags move, we get a good pose.
